multiple_intelligences.linguistic: Write a story or essay about gardening
multiple_intelligences.logical_mathematical: Analyze patterns and create logical arguments about gardening
multiple_intelligences.spatial: Create visual representations or mind maps of gardening
multiple_intelligences.bodily_kinesthetic: Role-play or act out scenarios related to gardening
multiple_intelligences.musical: Create a song or rhythm exercise about gardening
multiple_intelligences.interpersonal: Collaborate in groups to discuss gardening
multiple_intelligences.intrapersonal: Reflect individually on personal connection to gardening
multiple_intelligences.naturalistic: Categorize and classify concepts related to gardening

content.basic: Simplified texts and basic vocabulary about gardening
content.intermediate: Standard complexity materials with support about gardening
content.advanced: Complex authentic materials and academic texts about gardening

process.grouping: Individual, pairs, small groups, or whole class based on preference
process.choice: Multiple activity options aligned with learning style

differentiation.environment: Quiet study area with writing materials and references

warm_up.description: Students write quick responses about gardening
warm_up.materials: Paper and pens or digital writing tools

main_activities.description: Students receive information about gardening through reading_writing modality
Students practice language related to gardening using reading_writing approach
Students produce original content about gardening demonstrating advanced thinking

discussion_prompts: What are the implications of gardening for society?
How would you design a better approach to gardening?
What criteria would you use to evaluate gardening?

vocabulary_support.tier_2: Academic and topic-specific words for gardening
vocabulary_support.tier_3: Domain-specific technical terms related to gardening

homework_options.required: Core assignment at advanced level using reading_writing approach

teacher_notes.grouping_suggestions: Flexible grouping based on readiness and interest
teacher_notes.time_management: Build in flexibility for different pacing needs

common_difficulties: Students may lack background knowledge about gardening
Vocabulary may be challenging for some students
Some students may need more processing time
methodology: UDL + Differentiated Instruction + CLT + Multiple Intelligences
references: CAST Universal Design for Learning Guidelines
